titleInfo.title: United States House Amendment Number 1 (114th Congress)
United States House Amendment Number 1 (114th Congress)
FINANCIAL STABILITY OVERSIGHT COUNCIL REFORM ACT

name.namePart: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

extension.searchTitle: FINANCIAL STABILITY OVERSIGHT COUNCIL REFORM ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 57

congVote.result: So the motion to table was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Financial Stability Oversight Council Reform Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3340, to place the Financial Stability Oversight Council and the Office of Financial Research under the regular appropriations process, and to provide for certain quarterly reporting and public notice and comment requirements for the Office of Financial Research, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 179 nays, Roll No. 146.<P/>Agreed to table the appeal of the ruling of the chair on a point of order sustained against the Moore motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 176 nays, Roll No. 145.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Financial Stability Oversight Council Reform Act
Financial Stability Oversight Council Reform Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3340, to place the Financial Stability Oversight Council and the Office of Financial Research under the regular appropriations process, and to provide for certain quarterly reporting and public notice and comment requirements for the Office of Financial Research, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 179 nays, Roll No. 146.

The House passed H.R. 3340, to place the Financial Stability Oversight Council and the Office of Financial Research under the regular appropriations process, and to provide for certain quarterly reporting and public notice and comment requirements for the Office of Financial Research, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 179 nays, Roll No. 146.<P/>Agreed to table the appeal of the ruling of the chair on a point of order sustained against the Moore motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 239 yeas to 176 nays, Roll No. 145.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted.

congCommittee.name: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
Oversight and Government Reform

titleInfo.title: United States House Concurrent Resolution 125 (114th Congress)
United States House Amendment Number 1 (114th Congress)
United States House Amendment Number 1 (114th Congress)
United States House Amendment Number 1 (114th Congress)
RAISING CONSOLIDATED ASSETS THRESHOLD UNDER SMALL BANK HOLDING COMPANY POLICY STATEMENT

extension.searchTitle: RAISING CONSOLIDATED ASSETS THRESHOLD UNDER SMALL BANK HOLDING COMPANY POLICY STATEMENT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 57

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Raising the consolidated assets threshold under the small bank holding company policy statement
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3791, to raise the consolidated assets threshold under the small bank D372holding company policy statement, by a yea-and-nay vote of 247 yeas to 171 nays, Roll No. 149.<P/>Agreed to table the appeal of the ruling of the chair on a point of order sustained against the Moore motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Financial Services with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a recorded vote of 241 ayes to 177 noes, Roll No. 148.<P/>Kelly (IL) amendment (No. 1 printed in part B of H. Rept. 114-489) that sought to limit the asset threshold increase to $5 billion for bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies which have submitted to the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System a credible plan to expand access to banking accounts and services, consumer and small business credit products, and bank branches in rural, low-income, minority, and otherwise under-served communities (by a yea-and-nay vote of 165 yeas to 253 nays, Roll No. 147).

congVote.result: So the motion to table was agreed to.
